Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD erred in determining that the applicant did not face a personal risk upon return to El Salvador
Application_Facts: The applicant was threatened multiple times by a gang over several months in El Salvador
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of RPD decision, setting aside the decision, and redetermination
Court_Ruling: Judicial review allowed; RPD decision set aside; case remanded for reconsideration
Defendant_Behavior: Gang issued specific threats against the applicant over several months
Grounds_for_Claim: Personal risk to life and risk of cruel and unusual treatment or punishment
Assessment_Factor: Specificity of threats, duration of threats, targeting of individual
Evidence_Used: Details of repeated gang threats directed at the applicant
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution due to membership in a particular social group (individual targeted by gang)
Evidence_Assessed: Threats made by gang over several months
Governing_Rule: Under section 97 of IRPA, an individual must prove on a balance of probabilities they face a personal risk to life or risk of cruel and unusual treatment upon return
Evidentiary_Deficiency: RPD failed to properly assess personal nature of risk, treating it as generalized
Outcome: RPD decision overturned, case remanded for redetermination
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm from gang violence in El Salvador
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed he faced personal danger from gangs in El Salvador and sought refugee protection in Canada
Evidence_Handling: Court found RPD unreasonably dismissed evidence of specific threats
Legal_Provision_Violated: None â€“ issue was misapplication of Section 97 of IRPA
Evidence_Issues: Failure to distinguish between generalized violence and personal risk
Legal_Provision: Section 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessment: Threats were specific and repeated, indicating personal risk
Decision_Rationale: Manifest unreasonableness in concluding risk was generalized despite evidence of targeted threats
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient consideration of personalization of risk
